src_text: Cabinet met on Wednesday, 28 February 2018, at Tuynhuys, Cape Tow Issues in the environment1.
trg_text: Cabinet met on Wednesday, 28 February 2018, at Tuynhuys, Cape Tow Issues in the environment1.

src_text: National Budget Speech
trg_text: National Budget Speech

src_text: Cabinet appreciates the overwhelming confidence expressed in the 2018 National Budget which was tabled in Parliament, Cape Town, last wee In the recent spirit of renewal that has gripped our great nation, Cabinet calls on all South Africans to partner with government to grow our economy and create much-needed job The reduction in expenditure of R85 billion over the next three years demonstrates government s commitment to fiscal consolidation and the prudent allocation of resources to grow the econom
trg_text: Cabinet appreciates the overwhelming confidence expressed in the 2018 National Budget which was tabled in Parliament, Cape Town, last wee In the recent spirit of renewal that has gripped our great nation, Cabinet calls on all South Africans to partner with government to grow our economy and create much-needed job The reduction in expenditure of R85 billion over the next three years demonstrates government s commitment to fiscal consolidation and the prudent allocation of resources to grow the econom

src_text: The steps announced to slow the pace of debt accumulation and contain the budget deficit greatly improve our fiscal framework and give South Africans confidence in the future prospects of our econom
trg_text: The steps announced to slow the pace of debt accumulation and contain the budget deficit greatly improve our fiscal framework and give South Africans confidence in the future prospects of our econom

src_text: Cabinet is resolute that the interventions will reflect in our country s economic growth, affirm its economic standing and safeguard its investment grade statu
trg_text: Cabinet is resolute that the interventions will reflect in our country s economic growth, affirm its economic standing and safeguard its investment grade statu

src_text: The 2018 National Budget supports the poor in our society through a comprehensive social assistance programme and fee-free tertiary education for students from poor household
trg_text: The 2018 National Budget supports the poor in our society through a comprehensive social assistance programme and fee-free tertiary education for students from poor household

src_text: As a response to the concern raised on the Value-Added Tax (VAT) increases proposed, Cabinet is considering expanding the list of basic goods that are zero-rated on VAT Nelson Mandela Centenary
trg_text: As a response to the concern raised on the Value-Added Tax (VAT) increases proposed, Cabinet is considering expanding the list of basic goods that are zero-rated on VAT Nelson Mandela Centenary

src_text: Cabinet joins President Cyril Ramaphosa in his call on South Africans to reaffirm a shared commitment to serve people as we continue to celebrate the centenary of the birth of former President Nelson Mandel Madiba is the first President of a Democratic South Africa and would have turned 100 years of age on 18 July 2012.
trg_text: Cabinet joins President Cyril Ramaphosa in his call on South Africans to reaffirm a shared commitment to serve people as we continue to celebrate the centenary of the birth of former President Nelson Mandel Madiba is the first President of a Democratic South Africa and would have turned 100 years of age on 18 July 2012.

src_text: Madiba is a global icon who is revered worldwide as a Champion of Human Rights, non-racism and non-sexis He played a critical role in unifying South Africans, and inspiring democratic unity across Africa and the glob The first celebration of Nelson Mandela s centenary took place during the African Union Summit in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia in January 2018.
trg_text: Madiba is a global icon who is revered worldwide as a Champion of Human Rights, non-racism and non-sexis He played a critical role in unifying South Africans, and inspiring democratic unity across Africa and the glob The first celebration of Nelson Mandela s centenary took place during the African Union Summit in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia in January 2018.

src_text: A number of events will be held throughout the country this year to reflect on the life of Tata Madib Cabinet calls upon all South Africans to join in the centenary celebrations in their workplaces, schools, churches and civic organisation It calls on each one of us this year to emulate the values of Nelson Mandela by working in our respective ways to build a united, non-racist, non-sexist and prosperous countr The country also celebrates the centenary of one of the great daughters of the African soil Mama Albertina Sisulu, who dedicated her life to fight for the emancipation of women and the liberation of South Afric
trg_text: A number of events will be held throughout the country this year to reflect on the life of Tata Madib Cabinet calls upon all South Africans to join in the centenary celebrations in their workplaces, schools, churches and civic organisation It calls on each one of us this year to emulate the values of Nelson Mandela by working in our respective ways to build a united, non-racist, non-sexist and prosperous countr The country also celebrates the centenary of one of the great daughters of the African soil Mama Albertina Sisulu, who dedicated her life to fight for the emancipation of women and the liberation of South Afric

src_text: Cabinet will in the next meeting also outline a programme for the celebration of the Centenary of Mama Albertina Sisulu
trg_text: Cabinet will in the next meeting also outline a programme for the celebration of the Centenary of Mama Albertina Sisulu

src_text: Drought Cabinet appreciates the relentless efforts made by the Inter-Ministerial Committee on Drought together with stakeholders in all spheres of government and society in dealing with the persistent drought conditions that have hit several parts of the countr Apart from the fact that South Africa is a water-scarce country, the effects of global warming continue to affect the rain patterns, thus causing our dam levels to remain lo
trg_text: Drought Cabinet appreciates the relentless efforts made by the Inter-Ministerial Committee on Drought together with stakeholders in all spheres of government and society in dealing with the persistent drought conditions that have hit several parts of the countr Apart from the fact that South Africa is a water-scarce country, the effects of global warming continue to affect the rain patterns, thus causing our dam levels to remain lo

src_text: The Inter-Ministerial Task Team on Drought continues to facilitate work between national government, provinces and municipalities in all drought-affected area This includes implementing short, medium and long-term measures to address and mitigate the potential impact of this drough Government has made funds available to provide short-term assistance to affected province It has provided a relief grant worth R473 million and an additional R6 billion in the 2018/19 financial year to augment water infrastructure in the Western Cape
trg_text: The Inter-Ministerial Task Team on Drought continues to facilitate work between national government, provinces and municipalities in all drought-affected area This includes implementing short, medium and long-term measures to address and mitigate the potential impact of this drough Government has made funds available to provide short-term assistance to affected province It has provided a relief grant worth R473 million and an additional R6 billion in the 2018/19 financial year to augment water infrastructure in the Western Cape

src_text: Eastern Cape and Northern Cap Cabinet calls on all to continue to work with government in conserving water by using it responsibly and sparingl Cabinet remains committed to making South Africa a country of choice for visitors and potential investors alik 4.
trg_text: Eastern Cape and Northern Cap Cabinet calls on all to continue to work with government in conserving water by using it responsibly and sparingl Cabinet remains committed to making South Africa a country of choice for visitors and potential investors alik 4.

src_text: Police killings Cabinet expresses condolences to the families and friends of the five police officers and a former soldier who were recently brutally murdered in an attack on the Ngcobo Police Station in the Eastern Cap Cabinet strongly condemns any senseless killing of our servicemen and wome
trg_text: Police killings Cabinet expresses condolences to the families and friends of the five police officers and a former soldier who were recently brutally murdered in an attack on the Ngcobo Police Station in the Eastern Cap Cabinet strongly condemns any senseless killing of our servicemen and wome

src_text: The loss of one police officer, soldier or any other person who serves to protect society and our people is unacceptabl Cabinet has committed, through the Minister of Police, to do whatever possible to capacitate our police stations to prevent such attacks in the futur Cabinet further appeals to parents and society at large to ensure children are kept safe at all times and to partner with law-enforcement agencies to protect the rights of our childre Any form of abuse against a child must be exposed and reported immediatel By working together, we can keep our communities safe and ensure that criminal elements have no place to hid Cabinet decisions
trg_text: The loss of one police officer, soldier or any other person who serves to protect society and our people is unacceptabl Cabinet has committed, through the Minister of Police, to do whatever possible to capacitate our police stations to prevent such attacks in the futur Cabinet further appeals to parents and society at large to ensure children are kept safe at all times and to partner with law-enforcement agencies to protect the rights of our childre Any form of abuse against a child must be exposed and reported immediatel By working together, we can keep our communities safe and ensure that criminal elements have no place to hid Cabinet decisions

src_text: Cabinet approved the Draft Revised White Paper on National Transport Policy to be published for public comment The policy aims to provide a transport system that is integrated with other related sector plans so as to reduce both the cost of commuting and doing busines It also aligns the country s transportation plans to the global transportation trends Cabinet approved the Green Paper on Roads Policy for South Africa to be published for public comment The policy provides the overarching framework that ensures South Africa s roads are better managed, safer and include all modes of transport to deliver a sustainable approach to roads managemen It guides the road regulations, infrastructure, safety, road funding and non- motorised transport
trg_text: Cabinet approved the Draft Revised White Paper on National Transport Policy to be published for public comment The policy aims to provide a transport system that is integrated with other related sector plans so as to reduce both the cost of commuting and doing busines It also aligns the country s transportation plans to the global transportation trends Cabinet approved the Green Paper on Roads Policy for South Africa to be published for public comment The policy provides the overarching framework that ensures South Africa s roads are better managed, safer and include all modes of transport to deliver a sustainable approach to roads managemen It guides the road regulations, infrastructure, safety, road funding and non- motorised transport

src_text: Cabinet was briefed on the findings of the 2015/16 National Survey of Research and Experimental Development (R&D Survey).R&D is an integral part of the country s socio-economic developmen
trg_text: Cabinet was briefed on the findings of the 2015/16 National Survey of Research and Experimental Development (R&D Survey).R&D is an integral part of the country s socio-economic developmen

src_text: This has been collective efforts of government, industry and research institution The report is available on the Department of Science and Technology (DST) website: wwdsgoza Cabinet approved the designs of the 2018 commemorative collector s coin series, which will be produced by the South African Mint Compan The 2018 designs collection will be celebrating the Nelson Mandela Centenar These collections were preceded by the 2017 commemorative coins that celebrated South Africa under the theme of Freedom, Democracy and Culture Bills1.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Customary Initiation Bill of 2018 to Parliamen The Bill seeks to protect, promote and regulate the governance aspect of the practice of customary initiatioIt provides national norms and standards aimed at the protection of life and the prevention of injuries and all forms of abuse experienced by initiates Cabinet approved for the submission of the National Qualifications Framework Amendment Bill of 2016 to Parliamen The Bill, which amends the National Qualifications Framework Act, 2008 (Act 67 of 2008), strengthens the Act by improving measures to deal with issues of misrepresentation, imposes consequences on persons who misrepresent their qualifications or organisations that issue invalid qualificationIt also proposes regulations to ensure that fraudulent qualifications are referred to the relevant professional bodies (database of individuals who misrepresented their qualifications).
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Customary Initiation Bill of 2018 to Parliamen The Bill seeks to protect, promote and regulate the governance aspect of the practice of customary initiatioIt provides national norms and standards aimed at the protection of life and the prevention of injuries and all forms of abuse experienced by initiates Cabinet approved for the submission of the National Qualifications Framework Amendment Bill of 2016 to Parliamen The Bill, which amends the National Qualifications Framework Act, 2008 (Act 67 of 2008), strengthens the Act by improving measures to deal with issues of misrepresentation, imposes consequences on persons who misrepresent their qualifications or organisations that issue invalid qualificationIt also proposes regulations to ensure that fraudulent qualifications are referred to the relevant professional bodies (database of individuals who misrepresented their qualifications).

src_text: It also addresses the accreditation of foreign qualifications Cabinet approved the Railway Safety Bill of 2017 to be published for public comment The Bill seeks to improve railway safety and create a governance structure to oversee the work of the Rail Safety Regulator of South Afric It is also aligned to the National Rail Policy regarding the strengthening of safety monitoring, and the promotion and enforcement of safety in our railways Cabinet approved for the Draft Economic Regulation of Transport Bill of 2017 to be published for public comments and consultatio The Bill addresses the regulatory and capacity gaps in respect of provision of a cost-effective and efficient transport syste Upcoming events1.
trg_text: It also addresses the accreditation of foreign qualifications Cabinet approved the Railway Safety Bill of 2017 to be published for public comment The Bill seeks to improve railway safety and create a governance structure to oversee the work of the Rail Safety Regulator of South Afric It is also aligned to the National Rail Policy regarding the strengthening of safety monitoring, and the promotion and enforcement of safety in our railways Cabinet approved for the Draft Economic Regulation of Transport Bill of 2017 to be published for public comments and consultatio The Bill addresses the regulatory and capacity gaps in respect of provision of a cost-effective and efficient transport syste Upcoming events1.

src_text: This is the first hosting in AfricThe WTCOH calls for committed action and provides a platform for governments, civil-society organisations, United Nations agencies, international organisations, health workers and other stakeholders to discuss shared knowledge and experiences, particularly regarding to youth and women who are exposed to tobacco usHosting the conference contributes towards addressing the National Development Plan s goals by creating awareness and education on the harmful effects of tobacco use, and the need to intensify tobacco control measures On the 10 and 11 March the IEC will open the Voting Registration Centres for people to come and register and check their registration detail Cabinet urges all eligible voters to visit their voting stations to update the voters

src_text: roll in preparation for the 2019 general election Cabinet particularly calls on first-time voters to ensure they participate in their constitutional democratic right to vote by going to register to votThis registration weekend is a milestone towards the culmination of a two-year project to obtain the residential addresses of all registered voterThe voting stations will be open between 08:00 and 17:00 to assist new voters to register to vote, and allow registered voters who have relocated to reregister in their correct voting district and update their address details on the voters
